1{-# LANGUAGE FlexibleInstances #-}
2{-# LANGUAGE ViewPatterns #-}
3{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
4
5-- | Miscellaneous functions.
6
7module Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Misc
8 ( IOPath, GetIOPath (..),
9   uncons,
10   keepOn, omitOn,
11   zero,
12   ints,
13   printList,
14   truncateString,
15 ) where
16
17import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Type as O
18
19
20-- ---------------------------------  I/O path
21
22-- | URI, file path, etc.
23type IOPath = String
24
25-- | Type which has I/O path.
26class GetIOPath a where
27    getIOPath :: a -> IOPath
28
29instance GetIOPath String where
30    getIOPath = id
31
32
33-- ---------------------------------
34
35-- | Head and tail of list.
36--   This is a list version of text 'Data.Text.uncons'.
37--
38--   >>> uncons "abcdefg"
39--   Just ('a', "bcdefg")
40--
41{-# INLINE uncons #-}
42uncons :: [a] -> Maybe (a, [a])
43uncons (x : xs)  = Just (x, xs)
44uncons []        = Nothing
45
46-- | Keep elements.
47keepOn :: (a -> Maybe b) -> O.Test b -> O.Map [a]
48keepOn get f = loop where
49    loop (x@(get -> Just x') : xs)
50        | f x'       = x : loop xs
51        | otherwise  = loop xs
52    loop (_ : xs)    = loop xs
53    loop []          = []
54
55-- | Omit elements.
56omitOn :: (a -> Maybe b) -> O.Test b -> O.Map [a]
57omitOn get f = keepOn get (not . f)
58
59-- | 0 of type 'Int'.
60zero :: Int
61zero = 0
62
63-- | Inteeger list start with given integer.
64--
65--   >>> take 4 $ ints 1
66--   [1,2,3,4]
67--
68ints :: Int -> [Int]
69ints n = [n ..]
70
71-- | Print list.
72--
73--   >>> printList ["foo", "bar", "baz"]
74--   "foo"
75--   "bar"
76--   "baz"
77--
78printList :: (Show a) => [a] -> IO ()
79printList = mapM_ print
80
81-- | Truncate end of long string.
82--
83--   >>> truncateString 10 "abcdefg"
84--   "abcdefg"
85--
86--   >>> truncateString 10 "abcdefg hijklmn"
87--   "abcdefg..."
88--
89truncateString :: Int -> O.StringMap
90truncateString = truncateStringWith "..."
91
92truncateStringWith :: String -> Int -> O.StringMap
93truncateStringWith ellipsis size s
94    | length s > size  = take (size - 3) s ++ ellipsis
95    | otherwise        = s
96
